text: The state flower is a symbol for each state in USA, the state flowers for each state are: State Common name Scientific name Image Year Alabama Camellia (state flower) 1959 (clarified 1999) Alabama Oak-leaf hydrangea (state wildflower) 1999 Alaska Forget-me-not 2004 Arizona Saguaro cactus blossom 1931 Arkansas Apple blossom 1901 California California poppy 1903 Colorado Rocky Mountain Columbine 1899 Connecticut Mountain laurel 1907 Delaware Peach blossom 1953 Florida Orange blossom 1909 Florida Tickseed (state wildflower) 1991 Georgia Cherokee Rose (state floral emblem) 1916 Georgia Azalea (state wildflower) Hawaii Hawaiian hibiscus (mao hau hele) Idaho Syringa, Mock Orange 1931 Illinois Violet 1907 Indiana Peony Iowa Wild Prairie Rose Kansas Sunflower Kentucky Goldenrod 1926 Louisiana Magnolia (state flower) Louisiana Louisiana Iris (state wildflower) Maine White pine cone and tassel 1895 Maryland Black-eyed susan 1918 Massachusetts Mayflower 1918 Michigan Apple blossom (state flower) 1897 Michigan Dwarf Lake Iris (state wildflower) 1998 Minnesota Pink and white lady's slipper Mississippi Magnolia (state flower) Mississippi Tickseed (state wildflower) Missouri Hawthorn Montana Bitterroot 1895 Nebraska Goldenrod Nevada Sagebrush New Hampshire Purple lilac 1919 New Jersey Violet New Mexico Yucca flower 1927 New York Rose North Carolina Flowering Dogwood 1941 North Dakota Wild Prairie Rose or Ohio Scarlet Carnation (state flower) Large white trillium (state wild flower) Oklahoma Oklahoma Rose (state flower) Oklahoma Mistletoe (state floral emblem) Oklahoma Indian Blanket (state wildflower) Oregon Oregon grape Pennsylvania Mountain Laurel (state flower) 1933 Pennsylvania Penngift Crown Vetch (beautification and conservation plant) 1982 Rhode Island Violet 1968 South Carolina Yellow Jessamine 1924 South Carolina Goldenrod (state wildflower) 2003 South Dakota Pasque flower Tennessee Iris (state cultivated flower) 1933 Tennessee Purple Passionflower (state wildflower) 1919 Texas Bluebonnet sp. 1901 (clarified 1971) Utah Sego lily 1911Utah State Flower - Sego Lily from pioneer.utah.gov "Pioneer - Utah's Online Library" page. Retrieved on 2008-09-08. Vermont Red Clover 1894 Virginia American Dogwood Washington Coast Rhododendron 1892 (officially 1959) West Virginia Rhododendron Wisconsin Wood Violet 1909 Wyoming Indian Paintbrush 1917. == References == Flowers, List of U.S. state Category:Flowers Category:Lists of plants
title: List of U.S. state flowers
